intro: Chrysanthemum suaveolens, commonly known as the sweetly fragrant chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers emit a subtle, pleasant aroma. This species is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine.
